newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil, Argentina break off talks over import rule.
newsitem.headline: Brazil, Argentina break off talks over import rule.

text.p: Brazilian and Argentine officials discussing Brazil's new import financing rules Tuesday broke off talks in Brasilia and it was unclear whether they would resume, officials said.
A spokeswoman for the Brazilian Foreign Ministry said the Argentine delegation had decided to return to its embassy to consult and return later for more talks.
But a spokesman for the Argentine embassy said it remained unclear whether the delegation would return and whether there would be any more discussions.

The Argentine vice-ministers of foreign relations and international trade, among others, were in Brasilia to try to persuade the Brazilian government to exempt its Mercosur partners from the new import financing rules.

Facing a widening trade deficit, Brazil last Tuesday announced a decree forcing importers to buy up foreign exchange when they picked up their goods from customs, effectively curtailing all import financing operations of less than 360 days.
The move infuriated Mercosur partners Argentina, Uruguay and Paraguay, as well as associate member Chile.
